page.title: 11DARLEY DALE
page.content: Darley Dale covers roughly half a square kilometre of land.It is centred upon the A6 road surrounded by the hills and dales of Derbyshire. The village has a number of shops, including butchers,grocers,a hair salon and newsagents. To the west of the village lies St.Helens Church which was built in 1539 and stands next to a thousand year old Yew tree,planted in Roman times. Just outside the village is Stancliffe Hall Preparatory school which has 35 acres of land on which many activities take place. Much of the area to the north of Darley Dale is taken up by the Stancliffe Quarry which produces much of the sand stone required for building in the area.
